data.scheme_name: 80JJAA: Deduction For Employment of New Employees - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides deduction of 30% on additional employee costs for 3 consecutive assessment years.
data.eligibility: All business enterprises who has hired additional employees during a fiscal year are eligible under this section.
data.conditions:
1. Applicant have to file an ITR within the due date and submit a CA report in Form 10DA. 
  2. Business should be operational for at least 240 days in the previous year.
data.beneficiaries:
1. Applicable to any taxpayer (individual, HUF, firm, LLP, or company) engaged in a business.

 2. The business must be subject to a tax audit under Section 44AB.
data.prerequisites:
1. Additional Employee Criteria: - Employees must be engaged during the year for at least 240 days (150 days for businesses in manufacturing apparel, footwear, or leather goods). - Employees must not have been employed by the same business previously. 

2. Exclusions: - Employees with monthly emoluments exceeding ₹25,000 are not eligible. - Contractual and outsourced employees are excluded. - Contributions to provident funds or other retirement benefits must be paid for the employee.
data.context: The purpose of Section 80JJAA is to encourage employers to generate new employment opportunities in the formal sector and provide employment benefits to eligible employees.
data.objective: Section 80JJAA is to encourage employment generation in the formal sector and provide employment benefits to eligible employees by offering tax incentives to the employer for hiring them.
data.description:
1. Deduction of 30% of additional employee cost incurred in the previous year. 

2. Available for a period of 3 assessment years, starting from the year of employment.
data.how_to_apply:
Applicant have to submit Form 10DA (DSC is mandatory) one month before the due date of filing online on the Income Tax website.
Deduction should be claimed in the income tax return.
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get the deduction after fulfilling the given conditions.
data.additional_info:
• Business should be solely of applicant and not acquired from any other person. 
  • Applicant should not form a business by splitting up or reconstructing any other existing business. 
  • The determination of additional employee costs should be based on the following parameters: 
    1. The employee should earn a total salary of not more than Rs. 25,000 per month. 
    2. He/she should be employed for more than 240 days in the previous year. 
    3. He/She should be employed for more than 150 days in case of manufacture of apparel or footwear or leather products 
    4. The employee should have participated in a recognised Provident Fund like casual workers, etc. 
    5. The Government shouldn’t have paid the entire contribution of the EPF scheme for the employee.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. PAN
2. Aadhar
3. Create an account in the Income Tax website
